title: Bug 38131ajc needs -d option while correctly compiling classes from subpackage
OB: When compiling a class in a subpackage using the 'ajc' command, a directory named 'subpackage' gets created within the existing 'subpackage' directory.
EB: The 'ajc' command should behave the same way as the 'javac' command, which does not create a nested 'subpackage' directory when compiling classes from a subpackage.
SR: To reproduce the issue, execute the 'ajc' command with the appropriate options and try compiling a class from a subpackage. Compare the directory structure generated with the 'javac' command for the same scenario.
